"node": "9e57111e61baf60c7258f3ed3801d66e2bf3efb0",
"date": [1749054415.0, -7200],
"desc": "Bug 1970044 - Move schema annotations into the tree. r=freaktechnik a=coreycb\n\n\n\n\nThe main goal of this effort is to make the tree the only source of\ninformation for our WebExtension APIs. Our documentation is\nmostly generated from the schema files, but we are still not able\nto auto-generate it. Information has to be updated in different places,\nnone of which is documented.\n\nThis patch moves most of the information stored in \"overlay\" files in\nthe `webext-docs` repository [1] into annotation files. The concept\nitself is also changed: The overlay files could replace descriptions and\nother properties, which could hide updated information in the schema\nfiles. The new concept it to extend the schema with additional\ninformation.\n\nIn the past we tried to minimize the usage of overlay files and stuffed\nas much as we can into the schema description. This led to\nusage of undocumented tags in the descriptions, like \u003clituralinclude\u003e,\n\u003ccodeblock\u003e and others. We also ended up with line breaks (\\n) in the\nschema description in order to format the generated documentation. The\nannotation concept uses an array of well defined annotation objects, and\nthis patch moves all these \"quirks\" out of the schema descriptions into\nannotation objects. Consumers can now decide, if they want to use just\nthe main description, or any of the additional information available\nthrough annotation objects.\n\nWe also no longer have to dublicate an entire API definition for\nManifest V2 and Manifest V3 *just* to be able to provide different\ndescriptions (see the commands API).\n\nThis patch also introduces the `url-placeholder.json` file, which holds\nthe information currently hardcoded in the `webext-schemas-generator`\nrepository [2]. We also introduce a well documented macro to use these\nplaceholders: `$(url:\u003cname\u003e)`. This is in line with the already\nused macros `$(ref:\u003cname\u003e)`, `$(doc:\u003cname\u003e)` and `$(topic:\u003cname\u003e)`\nintroduced by mozilla-central. We decided to follow mozilla-central and\nno longer use `\u003ca\u003e` tags in the schemas, but the shorthand notation\n`$(url:\u003cname\u003e)[Title]`.\n\nWe still use tags like `\u003ccode\u003e`, `\u003cvar\u003e` and `\u003cem\u003e`. This will be\nrevisetted later.\n\nThe path forward is to update the `webext-schemas-generator` to include\nthe additional information in our post-processed schema files, and then\nintroduce a `webext-docs-generator` which will use that data to\nauto-generate the docs, without any further manual interaction.\n\n[1]:https://github.com/thunderbird/webext-docs/tree/56f005c0eb1c7433b50efe730a6c441882213cdc/overlay\n[2]:https://github.com/thunderbird/webext-schemas-generator/blob/3f1a8438dfc23a83376394502b07aa667bbc2822/get_thunderbird_schema_files.js#L78-L137\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D252284",

"date": [1724755019.0, -7200],
"desc": "Bug 1915253 - Fix more wrongly stated null / undefined return values in the schema files. r=aleca\n\nThis patch is not introducing a functional change.\n\n* accounts.get() in Manifest V3 stated in the description, that `null` can be returned, but did not specify it in the actual return type definition.\n* Some functions had \"This may return undefined\" as description in the return type definition, which is moved into the main description and  made more specific.\n* The `MailFolder` definition is split now for Manifest V2 and Manifest V3. In Manifest V3 most properties are no longer defined as optional. They were defined as optional in Manifest V2 because the `MailFolder` was used as a function parameter and we allowed to specify only `accountId` and `path`. In Manifest V3 function parameters only use the new `MailFolderId`.\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D220336",

"desc": "Bug 1912393 - Re-add support for rss accounts to the accounts API. r=Fallen a=coreycb\n\n\nThis is a continuation of D218763. We started to declare which account\ntypes are expected to be returned by the WebExtension API, instead of\nreturning an undocumented string.\n\nEven though the API never officially supported rss feed accounts, some\nadd-ons did interact with these accounts. Since D218763 these accounts\nare again returned by the API, but marked as experiment accounts,\nbecause we did not declare them as built-in. This is fixed in this\npatch.\n\nTest for rss accounts (we have not a single one) are added in Bug\n1912394.\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D218918",

"desc": "Bug 1901970 - Fix mailTabs.getSelectedMessages() not returning the selected messages, if a context menu is open. r=aleca a=wsmwk\n\n\nThe API used `dbView.getSelectedMsgHdrs()` to retrieve the selected\nmessages. However, that function is supressing the actual selected\nmessages, if a context menu had been opened on an unselected message.\n\nThis patch changes the behavior for `mailTabs.getSelectedMessages()` to\nalways return the selected messages. The patch does not change the\nbehavior for `menus.OnShowData` and `menus.OnClickedData`, which\nshould return the messages the context action should act upon (identical\nto Thunderbirds own UI behavior).\n\nThe patch adds a test for both, and a test to verify\n`mailTabs.setSelectedMessages()` in Manifest V3.\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D213406",

"desc": "Bug 1892890 - Change default value for `includeFolders` to false in Manifest V3. r=#thunderbird-reviewers\n\nThe methods to retrieve accounts and folders may return a lot of folder\nand subfolder data. In review I saw that most add-ons do not use the\ninformation and it may have unnecessary performance implications.\n\nThe initial implementation always returned all folders and the optional\nflag was added only later after such performance implications have been\nreported. We however could not change the default in Manifest V2 without\nbreaking add-ons. Doing that now for Manifest V3.\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D208312",

"node": "9d378df6594e44980fa24696b9d113dcfdbcd825",
"date": [1715204978.0, 0],
"desc": "Bug 1894193 - Be more precise regarding return types of WebExtension functions. r=aleca\n\nThis patch updates the schema files to correctly specify the return\nvalues of Thunderbird's WebExtension APIs. This aims to help create\nproper TypeScript type definitions directly from the schema files.\n\nThere are 3 areas of interest:\n\nThe callback function parameter, which we use to define the return\ntype is optinal. Our APIs can actually be used with callbacks, but\nthey are of course optional. Some of our APIs did not specify them as\noptional. The schema validator ignored these issues and they went by\nunnoticed.\n\nFunctions can either return `null` or `undefined` and our APIs did both\nwithout explicitly specifying which. We now use `optional: true` to\nindicate `undefined`. If a function returns `null`, it is explicity\nstated as a possible return value.\n\nSome of our WebExtensions APIs return objects with some/all of their\nproperties being defined as optional. Some of those however have been\nreturned as `null`, which is now fixed.\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D208998",

"node": "9e57111e61baf60c7258f3ed3801d66e2bf3efb0",
"date": [1749054415.0, -7200],
"desc": "Bug 1970044 - Move schema annotations into the tree. r=freaktechnik a=coreycb\n\n\n\n\nThe main goal of this effort is to make the tree the only source of\ninformation for our WebExtension APIs. Our documentation is\nmostly generated from the schema files, but we are still not able\nto auto-generate it. Information has to be updated in different places,\nnone of which is documented.\n\nThis patch moves most of the information stored in \"overlay\" files in\nthe `webext-docs` repository [1] into annotation files. The concept\nitself is also changed: The overlay files could replace descriptions and\nother properties, which could hide updated information in the schema\nfiles. The new concept it to extend the schema with additional\ninformation.\n\nIn the past we tried to minimize the usage of overlay files and stuffed\nas much as we can into the schema description. This led to\nusage of undocumented tags in the descriptions, like \u003clituralinclude\u003e,\n\u003ccodeblock\u003e and others. We also ended up with line breaks (\\n) in the\nschema description in order to format the generated documentation. The\nannotation concept uses an array of well defined annotation objects, and\nthis patch moves all these \"quirks\" out of the schema descriptions into\nannotation objects. Consumers can now decide, if they want to use just\nthe main description, or any of the additional information available\nthrough annotation objects.\n\nWe also no longer have to dublicate an entire API definition for\nManifest V2 and Manifest V3 *just* to be able to provide different\ndescriptions (see the commands API).\n\nThis patch also introduces the `url-placeholder.json` file, which holds\nthe information currently hardcoded in the `webext-schemas-generator`\nrepository [2]. We also introduce a well documented macro to use these\nplaceholders: `$(url:\u003cname\u003e)`. This is in line with the already\nused macros `$(ref:\u003cname\u003e)`, `$(doc:\u003cname\u003e)` and `$(topic:\u003cname\u003e)`\nintroduced by mozilla-central. We decided to follow mozilla-central and\nno longer use `\u003ca\u003e` tags in the schemas, but the shorthand notation\n`$(url:\u003cname\u003e)[Title]`.\n\nWe still use tags like `\u003ccode\u003e`, `\u003cvar\u003e` and `\u003cem\u003e`. This will be\nrevisetted later.\n\nThe path forward is to update the `webext-schemas-generator` to include\nthe additional information in our post-processed schema files, and then\nintroduce a `webext-docs-generator` which will use that data to\nauto-generate the docs, without any further manual interaction.\n\n[1]:https://github.com/thunderbird/webext-docs/tree/56f005c0eb1c7433b50efe730a6c441882213cdc/overlay\n[2]:https://github.com/thunderbird/webext-schemas-generator/blob/3f1a8438dfc23a83376394502b07aa667bbc2822/get_thunderbird_schema_files.js#L78-L137\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D252284",
"branch": "default",
"bookmarks": [],
"tags": [],
"user": "John Bieling \u003cjohn@thunderbird.net\u003e",

}, {
"node": "2c7b359fd2b1390f7e43dd2251ce11ba020a71cb",
"date": [1737197603.0, -7200],
"desc": "Bug 1941211 - No longer remove search address books when the background page is terminated. r=aleca\n\n\nThis event creates a read-only address book when being registered, and\nremoves it again, when being unregistered.\n\nManifest V3 terminates inactive backgrounds to save resources, which\ncauses the mentioned address book to be removed. This patch adds support\nfor the event to be registered as a persistent listener, which will\nimmediately re-register the listener as a \"primed\" listener, when the\nbackground terminates. Instead of removing and re-adding the address\nbook while the listener is primed, this patch keeps and re-uses the\nexisting address book, to reduce flicker in the UI.\n\nIt was necessary to move the actual listener implementation out of the\n`ExtSearchBook` class, into the closure of the event definition, to be\nable to use the updated `fire` function.\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D234495",
"branch": "default",

Other\nissues are:\n\n * remove single back tick reStructuredText notation\n * replace reStructuredText :doc:`...` notation by firefox notation\n * replace all links by placeholders and no longer use | notation\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D214178",

"desc": "Bug 1902610 - Replace reStructuredText inline link notation by \u003ca\u003e tags, keeping placeholders for now. r=mkmelin a=wsmwk\n\nOur schema files use notations which were originally intended to be\ninterpreted by our documentation generator only. However, other\nprojects started to parse them as well and this patch moves towards a\nnotation used by Firefox, to increase interoperability of such projects.\n\nWe use link placeholders which are currently replaced by the\ndocumentation generator. This patch is not touching them. We will\npost-process the original schema files and include additional\ninformation (for example, when an API method was added), and also split\nthe schema files for Manifest V2 and V3 for upstream consumers\n(instead of doing that in the documentation generator). The\npost-processor will also replace the links with their actual URLs. We\nmay re-evaluate this at a later time.\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D213748",

"node": "d70699ecd87d22178189b1c069dadf5b8fb42e5d",
"date": [1714721333.0, -7200],
"desc": "Bug 1894905 - Deprecate flat contact properties in Manifest V3 and only work with the vCard. r=#thunderbird-reviewers\n\nThis looks larger than it really is. For contacts, we currently return a\nproperty bag, which includes flat properties like \"PrimaryEmail\" or\n\"FirstName\", which is how the old address book stored contact data. We\nkept supporting these properties even after the internal storage was\nmoved to vCard. The vCard was just another property in said property bag\nand we applied some voodoo to allow extension developers to continue\nto set the flat properties, or the vCard.\n\nIn MV3 we stop doing that and just work with the vCard. This affects\nthe functions `contacts.create()` and `contacts.update()`, and also the\nevents `contacts.onCreated` and `contacts.onUpdated`.\n\nThis patch is not changing MV2 behavior.\n\nSince we no longer expose the internal property bag, this also removes\naccess to things like `preferDisplayName`, which is still a property of\nthe internal card. I believe it is bad practice to expose these\ninternals. If there is a request to be able to access such values,\nthey should be moved as X-Properties to the vCard (which would sync\nthese settings with the vCard between Thunderbird instances).\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D209384",
"branch": "default",
"bookmarks": [],
"tags": [],

"node": "1af98ebc0ece4f5722d609df2e8710c299594b91",
"date": [1713860783.0, -7200],
"desc": "Bug 1892890 - Change default value for `includeFolders` to false in Manifest V3. r=#thunderbird-reviewers\n\nThe methods to retrieve accounts and folders may return a lot of folder\nand subfolder data. In review I saw that most add-ons do not use the\ninformation and it may have unnecessary performance implications.\n\nThe initial implementation always returned all folders and the optional\nflag was added only later after such performance implications have been\nreported. We however could not change the default in Manifest V2 without\nbreaking add-ons. Doing that now for Manifest V3.\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D208312",
"branch": "default",

"node": "9d378df6594e44980fa24696b9d113dcfdbcd825",
"date": [1715204978.0, 0],
"desc": "Bug 1894193 - Be more precise regarding return types of WebExtension functions. r=aleca\n\nThis patch updates the schema files to correctly specify the return\nvalues of Thunderbird's WebExtension APIs. This aims to help create\nproper TypeScript type definitions directly from the schema files.\n\nThere are 3 areas of interest:\n\nThe callback function parameter, which we use to define the return\ntype is optinal. Our APIs can actually be used with callbacks, but\nthey are of course optional. Some of our APIs did not specify them as\noptional. The schema validator ignored these issues and they went by\nunnoticed.\n\nFunctions can either return `null` or `undefined` and our APIs did both\nwithout explicitly specifying which. We now use `optional: true` to\nindicate `undefined`. If a function returns `null`, it is explicity\nstated as a possible return value.\n\nSome of our WebExtensions APIs return objects with some/all of their\nproperties being defined as optional. Some of those however have been\nreturned as `null`, which is now fixed.\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D208998",
"branch": "default",
"bookmarks": [],
"tags": [],
"user": "John Bieling \u003cjohn@thunderbird.net\u003e",

"pushdate": [1715621963, 0]
}, {
"node": "33ad7f25b01736ded80081fcda40d8f93061fb94",
"date": [1714151974.0, -7200],
"desc": "Bug 1892981 - Rename contacts.quickSearch() to addressBook.contacts.query() in Manifest V3 and drop support for the string-only parameter. r=aleca\n\n\nRenames the `quickSearch()` function to `query()` and re-adds the former\nas a wrapper for the later. The wrapper handles the modified parameter\ndefinition. The query() function now only accepts a `queryInfo` object,\nwhich has gained the `parentId` property in Manifest V3.\n\nThis is consistent with our other `query()` functions, for example in\nthe messages API or the folders API.\n\nTherefore `contacts.quickSearch()` remains usable in Manifest V2 as\nbefore, and `addressBook.contacts.query()` is now usable in Manifest V3.\nAt a later time we can extend `query()` to support additional search\nterms/fields to better search vCards.\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D208374",

"node": "9e57111e61baf60c7258f3ed3801d66e2bf3efb0",
"date": [1749054415.0, -7200],
"desc": "Bug 1970044 - Move schema annotations into the tree. r=freaktechnik a=coreycb\n\n\n\n\nThe main goal of this effort is to make the tree the only source of\ninformation for our WebExtension APIs. Our documentation is\nmostly generated from the schema files, but we are still not able\nto auto-generate it. Information has to be updated in different places,\nnone of which is documented.\n\nThis patch moves most of the information stored in \"overlay\" files in\nthe `webext-docs` repository [1] into annotation files. The concept\nitself is also changed: The overlay files could replace descriptions and\nother properties, which could hide updated information in the schema\nfiles. The new concept it to extend the schema with additional\ninformation.\n\nIn the past we tried to minimize the usage of overlay files and stuffed\nas much as we can into the schema description. This led to\nusage of undocumented tags in the descriptions, like \u003clituralinclude\u003e,\n\u003ccodeblock\u003e and others. We also ended up with line breaks (\\n) in the\nschema description in order to format the generated documentation. The\nannotation concept uses an array of well defined annotation objects, and\nthis patch moves all these \"quirks\" out of the schema descriptions into\nannotation objects. Consumers can now decide, if they want to use just\nthe main description, or any of the additional information available\nthrough annotation objects.\n\nWe also no longer have to dublicate an entire API definition for\nManifest V2 and Manifest V3 *just* to be able to provide different\ndescriptions (see the commands API).\n\nThis patch also introduces the `url-placeholder.json` file, which holds\nthe information currently hardcoded in the `webext-schemas-generator`\nrepository [2]. We also introduce a well documented macro to use these\nplaceholders: `$(url:\u003cname\u003e)`. This is in line with the already\nused macros `$(ref:\u003cname\u003e)`, `$(doc:\u003cname\u003e)` and `$(topic:\u003cname\u003e)`\nintroduced by mozilla-central. We decided to follow mozilla-central and\nno longer use `\u003ca\u003e` tags in the schemas, but the shorthand notation\n`$(url:\u003cname\u003e)[Title]`.\n\nWe still use tags like `\u003ccode\u003e`, `\u003cvar\u003e` and `\u003cem\u003e`. This will be\nrevisetted later.\n\nThe path forward is to update the `webext-schemas-generator` to include\nthe additional information in our post-processed schema files, and then\nintroduce a `webext-docs-generator` which will use that data to\nauto-generate the docs, without any further manual interaction.\n\n[1]:https://github.com/thunderbird/webext-docs/tree/56f005c0eb1c7433b50efe730a6c441882213cdc/overlay\n[2]:https://github.com/thunderbird/webext-schemas-generator/blob/3f1a8438dfc23a83376394502b07aa667bbc2822/get_thunderbird_schema_files.js#L78-L137\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D252284",
"branch": "default",
"bookmarks": [],
"tags": [],

"desc": "Bug 1903248 - Fix more issues in the schema files. r=mkmelin a=coreycbryant\n\n\nWhile working on https://github.com/thunderbird/webext-schemas\nand generating the actual API documentation, a few more issues appeared.\n\nOne is a mistake I made: it should be `\u003cvar\u003e` and not `\u003cval\u003e`. Other\nissues are:\n\n * remove single back tick reStructuredText notation\n * replace reStructuredText :doc:`...` notation by firefox notation\n * replace all links by placeholders and no longer use | notation\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D214178",

}, {
"node": "23d89d6a87afe46444d8e244193113fd6ac47844",
"date": [1718446485.0, 0],
"desc": "Bug 1902610 - Always use \"async\": \"callback\" for functions returning a value. r=mkmelin a=wsmwk\n\nDefining a callback function allows the schema validator to validate the\nreturn value of the function in debug tests. This also allows add-ons\nto use the chrome coding style, where callback functions are used\ninstead of Promises.\n\nThere are a few cases, where such a callback function had been defined\nin the schema, but the method was not defined as having one.\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D213762",
"branch": "default",
"bookmarks": [],

"user": "John Bieling \u003cjohn@thunderbird.net\u003e",

}, {
"node": "8b9133b2b81e713510911f9afba0e086a9d6bf1f",
"date": [1718446484.0, 0],
"desc": "Bug 1902610 - Replace reStructuredText inline link notation by \u003ca\u003e tags, keeping placeholders for now. r=mkmelin a=wsmwk\n\nOur schema files use notations which were originally intended to be\ninterpreted by our documentation generator only. However, other\nprojects started to parse them as well and this patch moves towards a\nnotation used by Firefox, to increase interoperability of such projects.\n\nWe use link placeholders which are currently replaced by the\ndocumentation generator. This patch is not touching them. We will\npost-process the original schema files and include additional\ninformation (for example, when an API method was added), and also split\nthe schema files for Manifest V2 and V3 for upstream consumers\n(instead of doing that in the documentation generator). The\npost-processor will also replace the links with their actual URLs. We\nmay re-evaluate this at a later time.\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D213748",

"date": [1715856744.0, -10800],
"desc": "Bug 1873455 - Add support for action.setBadgeTextColor(). r=mkmelin\n\n\nAdds support to set the badge text color for all our action buttons.\n\nAlso adds tests for the badge text, badge text color and badge\nbackground color, which have not been tested before.\n\nThe tests for label and title only existed for the browser action\nbutton, which was acceptable since all action buttons once shared\nthe same implementation. However, with the introduction of the unified\ntoolbar, the implementation for the browser action button changed\nand the original implementation used by the compose and message\ndisplay action button became untested. Adding these missing tests here\nas well.\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D210372",

"node": "ad67a0c68f6caddc00bcba79055f868167430043",
"date": [1715681293.0, -10800],
"desc": "Bug 1896288 - Make default_area in action API manifest optional, and no longer throw. r=aleca\n\n\nAfter we introduced the unified toolbar, the action manifest property\n`default_area` was removed for Manifest V3. This however introduced\nan incompatibility with Firefox, and a simple WebExtension using an\naction button would throw. This patch re-adds support for the property,\nbut ignores it.\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D210127",

}, {
"node": "9d378df6594e44980fa24696b9d113dcfdbcd825",
"date": [1715204978.0, 0],
"desc": "Bug 1894193 - Be more precise regarding return types of WebExtension functions. r=aleca\n\nThis patch updates the schema files to correctly specify the return\nvalues of Thunderbird's WebExtension APIs. This aims to help create\nproper TypeScript type definitions directly from the schema files.\n\nThere are 3 areas of interest:\n\nThe callback function parameter, which we use to define the return\ntype is optinal. Our APIs can actually be used with callbacks, but\nthey are of course optional. Some of our APIs did not specify them as\noptional. The schema validator ignored these issues and they went by\nunnoticed.\n\nFunctions can either return `null` or `undefined` and our APIs did both\nwithout explicitly specifying which. We now use `optional: true` to\nindicate `undefined`. If a function returns `null`, it is explicity\nstated as a possible return value.\n\nSome of our WebExtensions APIs return objects with some/all of their\nproperties being defined as optional. Some of those however have been\nreturned as `null`, which is now fixed.\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D208998",
"branch": "default",

"node": "9e57111e61baf60c7258f3ed3801d66e2bf3efb0",
"date": [1749054415.0, -7200],
"desc": "Bug 1970044 - Move schema annotations into the tree. r=freaktechnik a=coreycb\n\n\n\n\nThe main goal of this effort is to make the tree the only source of\ninformation for our WebExtension APIs. Our documentation is\nmostly generated from the schema files, but we are still not able\nto auto-generate it. Information has to be updated in different places,\nnone of which is documented.\n\nThis patch moves most of the information stored in \"overlay\" files in\nthe `webext-docs` repository [1] into annotation files. The concept\nitself is also changed: The overlay files could replace descriptions and\nother properties, which could hide updated information in the schema\nfiles. The new concept it to extend the schema with additional\ninformation.\n\nIn the past we tried to minimize the usage of overlay files and stuffed\nas much as we can into the schema description. This led to\nusage of undocumented tags in the descriptions, like \u003clituralinclude\u003e,\n\u003ccodeblock\u003e and others. We also ended up with line breaks (\\n) in the\nschema description in order to format the generated documentation. The\nannotation concept uses an array of well defined annotation objects, and\nthis patch moves all these \"quirks\" out of the schema descriptions into\nannotation objects. Consumers can now decide, if they want to use just\nthe main description, or any of the additional information available\nthrough annotation objects.\n\nWe also no longer have to dublicate an entire API definition for\nManifest V2 and Manifest V3 *just* to be able to provide different\ndescriptions (see the commands API).\n\nThis patch also introduces the `url-placeholder.json` file, which holds\nthe information currently hardcoded in the `webext-schemas-generator`\nrepository [2]. We also introduce a well documented macro to use these\nplaceholders: `$(url:\u003cname\u003e)`. This is in line with the already\nused macros `$(ref:\u003cname\u003e)`, `$(doc:\u003cname\u003e)` and `$(topic:\u003cname\u003e)`\nintroduced by mozilla-central. We decided to follow mozilla-central and\nno longer use `\u003ca\u003e` tags in the schemas, but the shorthand notation\n`$(url:\u003cname\u003e)[Title]`.\n\nWe still use tags like `\u003ccode\u003e`, `\u003cvar\u003e` and `\u003cem\u003e`. This will be\nrevisetted later.\n\nThe path forward is to update the `webext-schemas-generator` to include\nthe additional information in our post-processed schema files, and then\nintroduce a `webext-docs-generator` which will use that data to\nauto-generate the docs, without any further manual interaction.\n\n[1]:https://github.com/thunderbird/webext-docs/tree/56f005c0eb1c7433b50efe730a6c441882213cdc/overlay\n[2]:https://github.com/thunderbird/webext-schemas-generator/blob/3f1a8438dfc23a83376394502b07aa667bbc2822/get_thunderbird_schema_files.js#L78-L137\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D252284",

"date": [1724755019.0, -7200],
"desc": "Bug 1915253 - Fix more wrongly stated null / undefined return values in the schema files. r=aleca\n\nThis patch is not introducing a functional change.\n\n* accounts.get() in Manifest V3 stated in the description, that `null` can be returned, but did not specify it in the actual return type definition.\n* Some functions had \"This may return undefined\" as description in the return type definition, which is moved into the main description and  made more specific.\n* The `MailFolder` definition is split now for Manifest V2 and Manifest V3. In Manifest V3 most properties are no longer defined as optional. They were defined as optional in Manifest V2 because the `MailFolder` was used as a function parameter and we allowed to specify only `accountId` and `path`. In Manifest V3 function parameters only use the new `MailFolderId`.\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D220336",

"date": [1718446484.0, 0],
"desc": "Bug 1902610 - Replace reStructuredText inline link notation by \u003ca\u003e tags, keeping placeholders for now. r=mkmelin a=wsmwk\n\nOur schema files use notations which were originally intended to be\ninterpreted by our documentation generator only. However, other\nprojects started to parse them as well and this patch moves towards a\nnotation used by Firefox, to increase interoperability of such projects.\n\nWe use link placeholders which are currently replaced by the\ndocumentation generator. This patch is not touching them. We will\npost-process the original schema files and include additional\ninformation (for example, when an API method was added), and also split\nthe schema files for Manifest V2 and V3 for upstream consumers\n(instead of doing that in the documentation generator). The\npost-processor will also replace the links with their actual URLs. We\nmay re-evaluate this at a later time.\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D213748",

"node": "9d378df6594e44980fa24696b9d113dcfdbcd825",
"date": [1715204978.0, 0],
"desc": "Bug 1894193 - Be more precise regarding return types of WebExtension functions. r=aleca\n\nThis patch updates the schema files to correctly specify the return\nvalues of Thunderbird's WebExtension APIs. This aims to help create\nproper TypeScript type definitions directly from the schema files.\n\nThere are 3 areas of interest:\n\nThe callback function parameter, which we use to define the return\ntype is optinal. Our APIs can actually be used with callbacks, but\nthey are of course optional. Some of our APIs did not specify them as\noptional. The schema validator ignored these issues and they went by\nunnoticed.\n\nFunctions can either return `null` or `undefined` and our APIs did both\nwithout explicitly specifying which. We now use `optional: true` to\nindicate `undefined`. If a function returns `null`, it is explicity\nstated as a possible return value.\n\nSome of our WebExtensions APIs return objects with some/all of their\nproperties being defined as optional. Some of those however have been\nreturned as `null`, which is now fixed.\n\nDifferential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D208998",
